poem:
Khan Younis

pomegranates split
in an arid square    
where voices rise,
murmur of smoke

400,000 shadows pressed
to stone, huddled 
in the hollowed space of night,
each breath a whispered ache

beneath a splintered sky
where hope flickers,  
a thin thread,
in the face of 

ruinous thunder.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Scores killed in Israeli attacks, medics say, after IDF orders evacuation of Gaza humanitarian zone The Israeli military has launched a fresh attack on the southern Gaza city of Khan Younis, killing at least 70 people according to medics, after ordering Palestinians to leave several neighbourhoods including areas that had been designated by the military as part of a humanitarian zone. Palestinian civil defence in the territory estimated that 400,000 people sheltering in the city". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Scores killed in Israeli attacks, medics say, after IDF orders evacuation of Gaza humanitarian zone The Israeli military has launched a fresh attack on the southern Gaza city of Khan Younis, killing at least 70 people according to medics, after ordering Palestinians to leave several neighbourhoods including areas that had been designated by the military as part of a humanitarian zone. Palestinian civil defence in the territory estimated that 400,000 people sheltering in the city
